snippet.textDisplay: The design behind Nick as a character was that he was supposed to be some kind of thug, or perhaps a criminal of sorts that decided to get himself a suit in the wake of the apocalypse. Someone sleazy for sure, but I wouldn't say Russian mob inspired.

snippet.textDisplay:
You know why? Because the game makes you expect a big turn, one of those that leaves you with your mouth open. The game does it, play with your mind, and in the end nothing happens. The truth is that I felt impressive that play by Dennaton.

4 years later, but I don't care.
snippet.textOriginal:
You know why? Because the game makes you expect a big turn, one of those that leaves you with your mouth open. The game does it, play with your mind, and in the end nothing happens. The truth is that I felt impressive that play by Dennaton.

4 years later, but I don't care.

snippet.textDisplay: I can't agree more with you about the music. Especially the songs by Moon appear on my playlist now and then, the other tracks feel more "situational" and only work in the context of the game for me. I do think that it doesn't need an expansion though. I feel that it would suffer if you'd introduce additional gameplay-mechanics or even "water it down". I'd be glad about mission-packs. Or hell, even an editor.
snippet.textOriginal: I can't agree more with you about the music. Especially the songs by Moon appear on my playlist now and then, the other tracks feel more "situational" and only work in the context of the game for me. I do think that it doesn't need an expansion though. I feel that it would suffer if you'd introduce additional gameplay-mechanics or even "water it down". I'd be glad about mission-packs. Or hell, even an editor.

snippet.textDisplay: It seems like the music made by MOON got the most attention, but I personally find this theme by Scattle to be the one that got me the most into it. You can definitely see why Drive (awesome movie) was an inspiration for this game.
snippet.textOriginal: It seems like the music made by MOON got the most attention, but I personally find this theme by Scattle to be the one that got me the most into it. You can definitely see why Drive (awesome movie) was an inspiration for this game.

snippet.textDisplay: I really enjoyed this game, it left me wanting more. I feel like this could be a great prototype for an even better and expanded game in the same kind of universe. It's a perfect example of music complementing a game and vice versa. One wouldn't be as good without the other. The OST pumps you up while playing the game. It has a couple themes like this one that are also very enjoyable outside the game.
snippet.textOriginal: I really enjoyed this game, it left me wanting more. I feel like this could be a great prototype for an even better and expanded game in the same kind of universe. It's a perfect example of music complementing a game and vice versa. One wouldn't be as good without the other. The OST pumps you up while playing the game. It has a couple themes like this one that are also very enjoyable outside the game.
